name: C++ Multiset
description: C++ Multisets are containers that store elements following a specific order, and where multiple elements can have equivalent values

Iterators.val: Returns an iterator referring to the first element in the multiset container
Returns an iterator referring to the past-the-end element in the multiset container
Returns a reverse iterator pointing to the last element in the container (i.e., its reverse beginning)
Returns a reverse iterator pointing to the theoretical element right before the first element in the multiset container
Returns a const_iterator pointing to the first element in the container (C++11 only)
Returns a const_iterator pointing to the past-the-end element in the container (C++11 only)
Returns a const_reverse_iterator pointing to the last element in the container (i.e., its reverse beginning) (C++11 only)
Returns a const_reverse_iterator pointing to the element that would theoretically precede the first element in the container (C++11 only)

Capacity.val: Returns whether the multiset container is empty (i.e. whether its size is 0)
Returns the number of elements in the multiset container
Returns the maximum number of elements that the multiset container can hold

Modifiers.val: Extends the container by inserting new elements, effectively increasing the container size by the number of elements inserted
Removes elements from the multiset container
Exchanges the content of the container by the content of x, which is another multiset of the same type
Removes all elements from the multiset container (which are destroyed), leaving the container with a size of 0
Inserts a new element in the multiset (C++11 only)
Inserts a new element in the multiset, with a hint on the insertion position (C++11 only)

Observers.val: Returns a copy of the comparison object used by the container
Returns a copy of the comparison object used by the container

Operations.val: Searches the container for an element equivalent to x and returns an iterator to it if found, otherwise it returns an iterator to multiset::end
Searches the container for elements equivalent to x and returns the number of matches
Returns an iterator pointing to the first element in the container which is not considered to go before x
Returns an iterator pointing to the first element in the container which is considered to go after x
Returns the bounds of a range that includes all the elements in the container that are equivalent to x

Allocator.val: Returns a copy of the allocator object associated with the multiset
